alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 16 at 3:11PM HST until January 17 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY EXTENDED FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... A reinforcing northwest swell (310-320 degrees) will keep surf heights at advisory levels across most north and west facing shores through early Tuesday morning, then decline over the following few days. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Surf along north and west facing shores of Niihau and north facing shores of Kauai 14 to 18 feet. Surf along west facing shores of Kauai 10 to 14 feet. Surf along north facing shores of Oahu, Molokai and Maui 12 to 16 feet. Surf along west facing shores of Oahu and Molokai 8 to 12 feet. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
